edge_1: Sestero agreed to play the character 'Mark' after Wiseau fired the original actor on the first day of filming
edge_2: Sestero wrote, produced, and starred in the independent drama The Room.

edge_1: Sestero agreed to play the character 'Mark' after Wiseau fired the original actor on the first day of filming
edge_2: friendship between Sestero and Wiseau before production began

edge_1: In a 2011 Entertainment Weekly article, Schklair announced that he desired credit for directing The Room due to Wiseau becoming too engrossed with his acting duties to direct the film properly. Schklair told EW that Wiseau asked him to 'tell the actors what to do' and 'yell Action' and 'Cut' and tell the cameraman what shots to get.' This story is corroborated by one of the film's actors (who requested anonymity) and by Sestero in The Disaster Artist.
edge_2: Wiseau refused to give up the director title, even when Schklair took charge of numerous sequences in which Wiseau found himself unable to remember lines or adequately interact with the rest of the cast.
